items.headline: Waiting for AI bubble to burst? The sector already has taken out the trash, says VanEck’s CEO.
items.summary_en: The chief executive of fund manager VanEck says investors waiting for the artificial-intelligence bubble have missed that it already did.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Air travelers experience pandemic-like flight cancellations. And it’s not over yet.
items.summary_en: Airlines have canceled about 20,000 flights due to a winter storm that walloped two-thirds of the U.S. over the weekend — with hubs in Dallas and Atlanta among the most affected.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: The market has cooled on tech. These are the trades to make now, says this strategist.
items.summary_en: Use options to play Meta, Microsoft and Apple says Evercore ISI

items.headline: Here’s what investors want even more than a Fed interest-rate cut this week
items.summary_en: Investors are rotating out of tech stocks and into other sectors of the market as the U.S. economy chugs along.

items.headline: Michael Burry says Japanese yen recovery is a risk to U.S. stocks
items.summary_en: The Big Short investor Michael Burry says the Japanese yen is due a reversal as a so-called “rate check” stirred debate over whether an appreciation in the Asian currency’s country would bleed over into U.S. stocks.

items.headline: The Fed meets this week. It’s expected to stand pat. The big question is for how long.
items.summary_en: Expectations of quick further cuts are evaporating, and the market doesn’t see another move until July

items.headline: Another cockroach? Why a private-credit fund run by BlackRock is getting hammered
items.summary_en: A private credit fund tied to the world’s largest asset manager was getting hit hard in premarket trade after revealing its net asset value will be marked down by nearly one-fifth.

items.headline: Trump administration partners with another rare-earth company. Should you buy the stock?
items.summary_en: USA Rare Earth’s stock soars after a partnership with the Trump administration, which gives the rare-earth company access to $1.6 billion in funding.

items.headline: Tax refunds could be much bigger this year. But is that really a good thing?
items.summary_en: Americans could see an extra $100 billion in tax refunds this year, according to a Bank of America economist.

items.headline: Natural-gas futures are surging again, even after last week’s historic surge
items.summary_en: Natural-gas prices are off to another blistering start on Monday as a bitter winter storm leaves thousands without power.
